description: \\The project intends to collect and analyze essential economic information on Greenland Halibut. In particular to collect information on the following: \\u2022 Where the fish are sold territorially, provincially and internationally (exports \\u2013 specifically how they leave Nunavut), and to whom (industry \\u2013 restaurants, grocery stores, etc.) \\u2022 Calculation of Profit margins for the industry \\u2022 An understanding of the path the income from the fisheries takes \\u2013 where does the money go (communities, fish plants, investments)?
full_summary: ================ ### Tender Notice #### Title Greenland Halibut Market Economic Information and Analysis #### Reference Number cb-570-48334268 #### Solicitation Number 30004868A #### Tender Status **Expired** Table of Contents --------------- 1. [Introduction](#introduction) 2. [Background](#background) 3. [Objective](#objective) 4. [Scope of Work](#scope-of-work) 5. [Information and Requirements](#information-and-requirements) 6. [Contact Information](#contact-information) ### Introduction Fisheries and Oceans Canada, Economics and Statistics, Arctic Region (DFO) invites proposals for an economic analysis of the Greenland Halibut commercial fisheries in Nunavut (specifically Subarea 0). The objective is to obtain a deeper understanding of the socio-economic impacts of these fisheries. ### Background The project aims to collect and analyze essential economic information on Greenland Halibut, including sales data, profit margins, and the flow of income from the fisheries. ### Objective * Obtain sales data for Greenland Halibut in Nunavut, including territorial, provincial, and international sales * Calculate profit margins for the industry * Understand the path the income from the fisheries takes, including where the money is spent in the community, fish plant investments, and other related activities. ### Scope of Work The proposed economic analysis will cover the following aspects: * Data collection and analysis of sales data, profit margins, and income flow * Identification of key stakeholders and their interests * Research on relevant literature and expert opinions * Development of recommendations for future economic analysis and research ### Information and Requirements Proposals must contain the following information: * A detailed project plan and timeline * A description of the proposed methodology and data collection strategies * A list of qualifications and experience of the proposed team * A budget breakdown and timeline for completion ### Contact Information For more information or to submit a proposal, please contact: Louise Martel E-mail: [louise.martel@dfo-mpo.gc.ca](mailto:louise.martel@dfo-mpo.gc.ca) Phone: 819-962-7325 Publications **Available on the Canada Buy Service Website:** [https://canadabuys.canada.ca](https://canadabuys.canada.ca) [35200/rfp-300
